channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Sick and demented': Trump demands that Virginia AG candidate drop out over 2022 texts
item.description: President Trump on Sunday called for Jay Jones to withdraw from the Virginia attorney-general race, citing text messages the Democrat sent in 2022 fan...

item.title: Shutdown set to drag into sixth day with no signs of a breakthrough in Congress
item.description: The government shutdown enters its sixth day on Monday with lawmakers still stuck in their partisan corners and no prospect of a swift resolution.

item.title: What the Meltdown over Hegseth’s All-Hands Military Speech Tells Us About Modern Media
item.description: Resistance Twitter can make any news event sound like the end of the world.

item.title: When Students Refuse to Be Friends, Our Republic Is at Risk
item.description: If we want to strengthen civic knowledge and civic trust in America, we must focus on the people who will teach these lessons every day.

item.title: Trump promises pay raises for military coming, despite government shutdown

item.title: The Jay Jones Misdirection
item.description: The Democratic candidate for attorney general in Virginia took aim at National Review for exposing his violent fantasies.

item.title: Climate Policy: EAT Your Greens
item.description: The week of September 29, 2025: The war on meat (and much, much more) continues, the debt, taxation, and, yes, much, much, more.

item.title: Biden Judge Gives Would-Be Kavanaugh Assassin Light Sentence As Left-Wing Violence Skyrockets

item.title: DOJ Opens Investigation Into Antifa-Indulging Portland Police
item.description: The probe follows the arrest of a conservative journalist who says he was taken into custody after being attacked by Antifa thugs.
